benchmark_details.name: LTLBench
benchmark_details.overview: LTLBench is a benchmark for evaluating the temporal reasoning ability of large language models (LLMs), constructed using a novel pipeline that generates controllable and scalable temporal reasoning problems based on random directed graph generation and linear temporal logic (LTL).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the temporal reasoning ability of large language models and provide insights into their performance and robustness in handling temporal reasoning challenges.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation includes a limited subset of LTL operators, omitting several complex operators that could enhance future assessments.

data.source: Generated using a random graph generation process, linear temporal logic (LTL) formulas, and NuSMV model checking.
data.annotation: Problems are labeled as True or False based on their ground truth obtained through model checking.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy, F1 Score, and AUC are calculated based on the model's performance on LTLBench problems.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate a better ability of models to handle complex temporal reasoning challenges.
methodology.baseline_results: The model qwen:72b-chat shows the highest Accuracy at 0.60, F1 at 0.59, and AUC at 0.60.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated through comprehensive evaluations on six large language models.
